snippet: Some schools in New York City serve more special-needs students than others.
abstract: Op-Ed article by journalism Prof Andrea Gabor cites data showing that New York City charter schools have potential to undermine traditional public schools and the children they serve; says special-needs children are particularly affected; contends charter schools must be held to same accountability measures for enrollment, attrition and discipline as public schools; decries two-tier system in which neediest students are left behind.
lead_paragraph: Some schools in New York City serve more special-needs students than others.
